------------------------------------------------------------------------
r5837 | lsantha | 2011-07-25 09:57:25 +0200 (lun, 25 jui 2011) | 5 lines

Patch contributed by griff with the following comments:
The patch implements:
 48 bit ide lba addresses. 28 bit lba addresses were implemented but 48 bit was not and it is required for larger disks (> 137G) .
 Extended partition tables were mostly there and just needed fixing.
 Fixed an exception that sometimes caused the cd to fail to load while booting from the cd. The cause was that read atapi commands did not deal with padding.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r5812 | lsantha | 2011-06-05 10:59:23 +0200 (dim, 05 jun 2011) | 4 lines

Applied patch by Daniel Noll: 
"Infinite loop reading NTFS indexes if disk exhibits a certain kind of corruption.
I found a situation where an IndexEntryIterator's offset will not be incremented each time next() is called, if the size of an entry is zero (presumably due to corruption.)
Attached patch makes this condition fail faster with an ISE."
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r5385 | chrisboertien | 2009-05-03 06:17:51 +0200 (dim, 03 mai 2009) | 17 lines

Updates to command utilities and grep

ADW
- protected access to the filter mechansim
- new optional callback for special files
- directory filters to prevent recursing whole directory branches
- directories beyond max level are no longer recursed
- bunch of new javadoc

IOUtils
- methods to read all the lines of a file into a List

GrepCommand
- reworked to use ADW

r5347 | chrisboertien | 2009-04-25 21:54:13 +0200 (sam, 25 avr 2009) | 7 lines

Isolate socket was causing a SocketException when getXStream was called because
the Socket.isConnected would never return true, as we dont actually connect
the socket. This override sets the socket to always connected. And at least allows
the isolate invoker to work.

Updates to ADW and FindCommand javadoc by Alexander Kerner

Added a walk(List<File) method to ADW and changed the behavior of ADW to not
rewrite pathnames into canonical form. If canonical form is wanted then the
caller should do this before, otherwise it is likely unexpected.

proclet context of the command being launched.

r5029 | konkubinaten | 2009-02-15 22:29:10 +0100 (dim, 15 fév 2009) | 2 lines

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r5028 | konkubinaten | 2009-02-15 22:26:21 +0100 (dim, 15 fév 2009) | 3 lines

added an initial version of a Cirrus driver for usage in kvm.
Basic mode setting works but the sequencer is not setup correctly. As DDC is not supported with kvm this code is not tested and values used in kvm are static configurations using VesaGTF. A bios-parser might be considered to get the native resolution. The spec can be found here: http://www.tjd.phlegethon.org/gd5446trm.pdf.gz

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r5027 | konkubinaten | 2009-02-15 22:17:59 +0100 (dim, 15 fév 2009) | 3 lines

added an implementation for the Vesa general timing formular.
It can be used to calculate timing values needed for crtc programming from a given resolution and refresh rate.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r5026 | crawley | 2009-02-15 06:39:30 +0100 (dim, 15 fév 2009) | 5 lines

Changes to core infrastructure to allow 'procletization' of the System
properties and environment.  System.getenv() et al are wired up, but 
System.getProperties() et al are not.  Also implemented in shell, the 
proclet-mode invoker and the Bjorne interpreter (via the 'export' built-in).

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4703 | crawley | 2008-11-16 03:53:07 +0100 (dim, 16 nov 2008) | 7 lines

Overhaul the help subsystem to make it easier to hook in ESC help, and
support anticipated future developments.  This also addresses a previously
unnoticed problem where HelpCommand triggered class loading for all known
aliases, and improves diagnostics for class load failure.  This checkin
will probably break 'old' syntax command completion (see issue #2802) but
AFAIK, there are no extant commands using the 'old' syntax mechanism.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4702 | crawley | 2008-11-12 14:47:18 +0100 (mer, 12 nov 2008) | 3 lines

This implements the input and shell-side parts of a "command help" keyboard 
action: typing ESC at a partial command line will print help for the command. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4701 | crawley | 2008-11-11 13:45:05 +0100 (mar, 11 nov 2008) | 5 lines

The 'cd' command must be internal so that it changes the 'user.dir'
"system" property for the shell ... not the current isolate.  (This
matters for the isolate invoker where the shell and current command
are normally in different isolates.)

r4028 | crawley | 2008-04-27 09:09:02 +0200 (dim, 27 avr 2008) | 5 lines

Fix for bug 2590.  The Thread constructors were calling group.add(Thread) 
instead of group.addUnstarted() which was messing the ThreadGroup's count
of unstarted Threads.  This caused 'daemon' ThreadGroups to not be destroyed
when their Threads / child ThreadGroups went away.

r2440 | epr | 2006-03-28 20:16:25 +0200 (mar, 28 mar 2006) | 13 lines

Added "-i" option

Together with the -n option it creates a new console in a new isolate


so:

> console -n
starts new console in same isolate

> console -n -i
starts new console in new isolate

r2008 | epr | 2005-08-21 14:30:16 +0200 (dim, 21 aoû 2005) | 4 lines

Moved shared part of class initializers to method trailer, for:
1) it can be shared between all class initializer calls
2) the inlined class initialize code is much smaller, so has better cache hits

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r2007 | epr | 2005-08-21 14:22:37 +0200 (dim, 21 aoû 2005) | 4 lines

Moved shared part of class initializers to method trailer, for:
1) it can be shared between all class initializer calls
2) the inlined class initialize code is much smaller, so has better cache hits

r1798 | fduminy | 2005-06-21 21:15:55 +0200 (mar, 21 jun 2005) | 5 lines

patch from Patrick Gwiasda
When the command format -t fat16 is used with hda instead of hda0
there is a classcast exception in FatFileSystemType line 114.
The BlockDeviceAPI for the hda is from the type BlockAligmentSupport so the cast to FSBlockDeviceAPI fails.

r1666 | epr | 2005-05-21 20:40:39 +0200 (sam, 21 mai 2005) | 3 lines

More consequent usage of mmap / munmap in the context of virtual memory region.
This is needs for ACPI to work with the new MMtk based memory managers, since ACPI tables are located somewhere in the physical address space, that cannot be mapped 1:1 on virtual address space, because that would overlap with the AVAILABLE region for the memory manager

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1411 | epr | 2005-04-25 19:15:25 +0200 (lun, 25 avr 2005) | 6 lines

Changed the build wrt. the way objects are emitted to the bootimage.
Until now, objects were written by writing its fields in declaring order.
Now objects are written by first allocating enough space for them and "overwriting" that space with the actual field values.

This way fields do not need to be in declaring order.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r416 | epr | 2004-04-12 15:38:50 +0200 (lun, 12 avr 2004) | 7 lines

Major change in plugin system
Now plugins are started when their classloader detects that classes from the plugin are used.
When a plugin starts, all required plugins are also started (first)

To start a plugin even if it is not required anywhere, an "auto-start" property has been added. 
Set this property to true for services that need to run at boot/load time.

Fixed successor bug.
Conditional brances did not set nextIsSuccessor = true which lead to
cases where following block was not a successor. This caused
NullPointerExceptions when getting variables for a basic block in
IRGenerator.
